markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 4" pfs="Standard">
[Countless Eyes](/Spells.aspx?ID=1983)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 243 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Eyes form across the touched creature's body, allowing it to see in all directions at once. The subject can't be flanked for the spell's duration. In addition, when the subject succeeds when [Seeking](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301), it critically succeeds instead.
name: Countless Eyes
search_markdown:
<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
</traits>

<additional-info>
**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 243 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

 

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>
</additional-info>

---

<summary>
Spawn magical eyes all over a creature’s body.
</summary>
summary: Spawn magical eyes all over a creature’s body.
summary_markdown: Spawn magical eyes all over a creature’s body.
text: Countless Eyes Two Actions Source Player Core 2 pg. 243 1.1 Traditions Arcane, Occult, Primal Range touch Target 1 creature Duration 1 minute --- Eyes form across the touched creature's body, allowing it to see in all directions at once. The subject can't be flanked for the spell's duration. In addition, when the subject succeeds when Seeking, it critically succeeds instead.
